DataElement.preferredDefinition: A value that represents the measured or measurable period during which an action, process, or condition exists or continues.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past. It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Property.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A value that represents the measured or measurable period during which an action, process, or condition exists or continues.  [Explanatory comment:  The preferred exchange format for Time is hhmmss.uuuu[+|-]ZZzz where hh is an Hour with numbers between 00 and 23, (00 being  midnight and 12 being noon), mm is a Minute with are numbers between 00 and 59, ss is Seconds with numbers between 00 and 59, uuuu is optional Fractional Seconds with integers (0 to 9) in any position, and [+|-]ZZzz is the optional  difference in hours (ZZ - integers +14 to -13) and minutes (zz - values 0 to 59) from the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Full Time would contain all three elements in the format hhmmss. Partial Time may be expressed by using the data elements for Hour, Minute, or Second. The display format for Time information is determined by programmatic requirements.]

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The information contained in a data field.

Concepts.definition: The information contained in a data field. It may represent a numeric quantity, a textual characterization, a date or time measurement, or some other state, depending on the nature of the attribute.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Date/Time Documentation
ReferenceDocuments.description: Definition of basic generic data elements for exchange of Date and Time information.

ReferenceDocuments.name: 1-COMMENT
ReferenceDocuments.description: The preferred exchange format for Time is hhmmss.uuuu[+|-]ZZzz where hh=hours, mm=minutes, ss=seconds, uuuu=optional fractional seconds, and [+|-]ZZzz=optional difference in hours (ZZ - 24 hr clock) and minutes (zz - values 0 to 59) from the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).  A Full Time would contain hhmmss. Partial Time may be expressed by using the data elements for Hour, Minute, or Second. The display format for Time information is determined by programmatic requirements.
